conclusion: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, represented by the slope of the curve on a velocity-time graph.
At t1, the velocity of Object A is decreasing, and its curve is sloping downward.
Object A has a negative acceleration at t1.
At t1, the velocity of Object B is increasing, and its curve is sloping upward.
Object B has a positive acceleration at t1.
The slope of Object A's curve at t1 is negative, indicating negative acceleration.
The slope of Object B's curve at t1 is positive, indicating positive acceleration.
Since Object A's slope is negative and Object B's slope is positive, their accelerations are not the same at t1.
The accelerations of Object A and Object B at t1 are not the same because Object A has a negative acceleration and Object B has a positive acceleration.
No, Object A and Object B do not have the same acceleration at time t1.
